Premier League debut with Manchester United.
Is named captain of England's national team.
Receives an Officer of the Order of the British Empire (OBE) from Queen Elizabeth II.
Appointed UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador, with a focus on the program Sport for Development.
Is awarded libel damages from the tabloid, the People, that accused him of making hate calls to a former nanny.
Settles a libel case against the British tabloid, News of the World, over a 2004 headline that read, "Posh and Becks on the Rocks."
Plays his first game with the LA Galaxy.
It is initially reported he will receive an estimated $250 million over the life of his five-year contract, but later revealed that the Galaxy will pay him $32.5 million over five years.
Appears for the 100th time in an England uniform.
During the England/France game Beckham receives a standing ovation from both sides as he leaves the field during a substitution.
Tears an Achilles tendon during an AC Milan match and is unable to play in the World Cup.
Plays his final game with the LA Galaxy.
Announces that he has signed with Paris Saint-Germain for five months and will donate the pay to a children's charity in Paris.
Announces that he will retire from professional soccer at the end of his season.
Announces he will establish a Major League Soccer franchise in Miami.
- Launches 7: The David Beckham UNICEF Fund, a collaboration with UNICEF to help kids in danger zones around the world.
People names Beckham its "Sexiest Man Alive" for 2015.
MLS announces that Miami has been awarded the league's 25th franchise
